intro: Schmaltzia sabulosa, commonly known as sand larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, and the stems are usually hairy as well. Schmaltzia sabulosa is part of the Polemoniaceae family and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
